page.title: 03SEDBERGH - SOUTH-WEST
page.content: Birks Mill is an egg-packing station which was expanded to accomodate a thriving frozen food business. Near the mill is Birks village whose recent occupants, many of whom are professional people working at the public school, have renovated the properties. On the Kendal road out of Sedbergh to the west is Close's Garage, one of five garages which serve the Sedbergh motorist. The owner considers his business to be quite secure in an area where the car is a necessity rather than a luxury. Further out on the Kendal road is the{Old Station}which had two sidings until its closure in 1964. The premises continue to be used as a coal yard. Over a 25 mile radius this yard delivers 40,000 tons of coal every year.
